intro: Angraecum caulescens var. multiflorum, commonly known as the multiblooming angraecum, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Madagascar. This epiphytic plant is characterized by its compact, branching growth habit and produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The leaves are typically dark green,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. The plant is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated for its unique floral display.
